stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.

Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM THE SUN-BAKED BOWL! üéôÔ∏è

Hello, hello, hello, you beautiful bags of meat and misery! It is your favorite voice from the abyss, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live for the Week 7 Tuesday Night Trollball finale! We are deep in the Great Desert at the Sun-Baked Bowl, where the heat is high, the stakes are higher, and the sand is just waiting to turn every open wound into a gritty mess! We have got a real treat today as the Warden-backed Oak & Onslaught travel into the dunes to face off against the Desert Spectres. The atmosphere is absolutely electric, or maybe that is just the dehydration-induced hallucinations kicking in! I see Steve over there with the Spectres already organizing a betting pool‚Äîthat is the spirit, kid! Show me the gold!

Now, let's talk rituals! In the home dugout, the Spectres are getting weird. Fidellia Mozelle is sniffing burnt wood like it is a fine perfume, while Muscolo Jaehne is methodically tearing leaves into tiny pieces. I love that kind of obsessive-compulsive energy! And keep an eye on Verlee Dacia; she is eating honeycomb to 'sweeten' the win. Personally, I prefer my victories flavored with the tears of a palooka, but to each their own! My pal Geth the Gravelord is watching from the VIP dunes, and you know he expects nothing less than a massacre from his Spectres today!

Over in the away camp, the Oak & Onslaught crew are looking... well, they are looking confused! Wynnie Faina has his boots on the wrong feet again! Is it a tactical advantage or is he just a knucklehead? Only the abyss knows! Milt Casady is leading a chant that is getting loud enough to rattle the sandstone, and Symer Crissy is giving the troll head a heroic backstory. Give me a break! The only backstory that ball needs is that it used to be attached to a neck! With the Wardens watching, like Sir Randy and his fancy-pants bow, these guys have a lot to prove before the playoffs!

But the real news? It is an OPEN BAR match, folks! Oh, I can already hear the liver failure from the commentary booth! The ale is flowing like the River Styx, and I expect the coordination to drop faster than a soul in my boss's dungeon. These players are going to be so pickled by halftime they will be tackling their own reflections! It is the last week before the playoffs, and the tension is thicker than a swamp-ogre's neck. Better these guys than those insufferable, shiny-armored Haven Lights, am I right? If I see one more 'heroic' speech from those goody-two-shoes, I‚Äôll vomit a swarm of locusts! Let‚Äôs get to the carnage! üõ°Ô∏è‚öîÔ∏èüè∫
postGame:
# üèÜ OAK & ONSLAUGHT LEAVE THE SPECTRES IN THE DUST! üèÜ

What a game, folks! What a beautiful, drunken, blood-soaked disaster! Final score: Oak & Onslaught 5, Desert Spectres 2! It was a real humdinger of a match where the booze was plentiful and the coordination was... well, let's just say the ground got tackled more than the players! The Wardens‚Äô own Oak & Onslaught took home the victory, proving that even with boots on the wrong feet, they can still navigate a desert better than the locals! 

The action started hot and fast! Ema Ulrick snatched up that troll head right at the whistle, but it was Symer Crissy who stole the show early on. Crissy launched two beautiful shots from center field, finding the basket and sending the crowd into a frenzy! Every time that leather head hit the net, the open bar worked overtime. I haven't seen this much drinking since the last time Lord Orzalon had a birthday bash in the Demon Prison! 

Speaking of the drink, Heyes Iver and Abner Seidel were looking tipsy before the first quarter was even over! But that didn't stop the scoring. Millham Evangeline, apparently thriving on a little liquid courage, hammered home two more scores from center field! Evangeline made it look easy while the Spectres were still trying to figure out which way the basket was facing. It was a clinic in drunken precision, folks! 

Then we had the highlight of the half: Hole Bowerman! This Warden warrior was stumbling around in a drunken stupor but somehow found the end zone twice! Bowerman literally dunked the ball into the goal, probably thinking it was a giant mug of ale! At that point, the Spectres were so deep in the cups that Shelman McQuoid was just wandering around aimlessly. I haven‚Äôt seen a man that lost since Sir Randy tried to find his way out of a paper bag without his 'fancy bow' to guide him!

The violence was top-shelf, too! Wynnie Faina, despite the boot situation, managed to tipsily tackle Huesman Ring right into the infirmary! It was a glorious sight to see Huesman Ring get absolutely leveled not once, but twice! I love the sound of plate armor crunching in the morning! Millham Evangeline joined the fray, drunkenly tackling Heyes Iver so hard I think I saw his soul try to leave his body. That's the Trollball spirit!

The Spectres didn't go down without a fight, though. Lovash Marius decided to show some spine in the second half, despite the intense heat and the dehydration! Marius launched two desperate, drunken shots from the away field that actually found their mark! It was a valiant effort for a team that looked like they were trying to play underwater. Geth the Gravelord is going to be disappointed in his Spectres tonight, but hey, at least they‚Äôll have a hell of a hangover to remember it by!

Muscolo Jaehne was absolutely plastered by the end! Jaehne managed to tackle Affra Yanaton into an injury, which was a nice touch of brutality amidst the fumbling. We saw interceptions, we saw wild passes that hit the dirt, and we saw more stumbling than a newborn fawn on ice! Teria Ravo was out there shooting wild, and the ball was changing hands like a hot potato at a demon's picnic! 

The stadium was a character all its own today! That Sun-Baked Bowl really took its toll. You could see the players wilting under the oppressive heat, their armor probably acting like a portable oven. I saw Eileen Mikihisa trying to tackle Crissy and missing by a country mile‚ÄîI blame the sand in his eyes and the gin in his belly! It‚Äôs a miracle anyone stayed upright long enough to score!

And let's talk about the 'heroes' of the realm! If Sir Artorias or that warlock Morgwae had been out there, they probably would have spent the whole game trying to 'save' the Trollball instead of throwing it! Give me a break! These players showed more heart (and liver capacity) than those fancy adventurers ever could. I‚Äôm just glad we didn‚Äôt have to deal with any fey nonsense today; just good, old-fashioned desert brawling! 

As the final whistle blew, Oak & Onslaught stood tall at 5-2. The Wardens will be celebrating tonight, probably by headbutting trees or whatever it is they do for fun. The Spectres, meanwhile, are likely passed out in the dunes. I hope someone remembers to fetch them before the sandstorms move in, or we‚Äôll have a few more spectres to add to the team roster next week! 

What a hoot! What a holler! Trollball at its finest, folks! The brutality was high, the skill was questionable, and the alcohol content was through the roof! I‚Äôm Nok the Corrupter, wishing you all a night of terrible dreams and even worse hangovers! See you in the playoffs for more Trollball mayhem! Stay corrupted, Osterra! üèüÔ∏èüç∑üíÄ
